intro: Wissadula macrantha var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked whitebeard lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces dense clusters of blooms that appear in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are strap-shaped and often persist through the winter, providing evergreen structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
